intro: Biophytum castum, commonly known as the "butterfly plant," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink, red, and yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it a favored ornamental plant in arid climates.
